attributes.action: Stop NHS Kernow CCG charging patients for transport to/from life-saving dialysis
attributes.additional_details:
Fiona Loud, Policy Director at Kidney Care UK, said: “We are extremely worried that some vulnerable patients may not be able to afford to travel and may simply not attend dialysis which will result in death. We think there are major patient safety and wellbeing concerns and urge NHS Kernow CCG to halt this course of action." 
Please sign this petition to stop NHS Kernow putting lives at risk & setting a dangerous precedent that other CCGs could follow.
attributes.background: From 30 September 2017 NHS Kernow CCG will make many dialysis patients pay for travel to/from their life-saving treatment. This will cost £hundreds each month & almost 100 patients will have to pay. Without treatment they will die so they may have to forgo food/heating to afford it. This is wrong.

rejection.details:
This decision is the responsibility of NHS Kernow CCG, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You can find out how to make a complaint about NHS Kernow CCG here:

https://www.kernowccg.nhs.uk/contact-us/making-a-complaint/
